content.description: Begin on face holds under a large white spot on the rock. Go straight up over a small bulge to get to a good ledge. Traverse left to the black streak with good holds. Follow the streak up to the blunt arete, and follow this by climbing up and left. Finish at a fixed anchor.
content.protection: Bolts spaced about 12 feet apart on the face. Fixed anchors at the top of the climb.
content.location: Directly right of the route Bee Hold, under a white streak.

content.description: Pull onto the slab with a mantel move then traverse right and follow the bolted line up the arete.  Near the top traverse back left toward the middle of the face, there is a bolt over the lip which is hard to see.  Then 4th class to the fixed anchors.  There are several other bouldery start variants you can do that go at 5.8/5.9.
content.location: About 20' left of where the trail splits.

climbs.name: Raw Tips
climbs.fa: 2007, Ian Osteyee, Justin McGiver, Shyloah Nilsen

content.description:
Start at the lowest point of the cliff, making some delicate moves up to the first bolt at 15 ft.  

  Climb up past 3 bolts to a right facing corner with a crack in it. Bring a 0.5 Camalot or equivalent for the crack. Pull into a stance in an alcove, clip a bolt, and puzzle over where to go next.  

  This is an interesting route with several cruxes that are as much mental as physical.
content.protection: Bolts and 1 or 2 finger sized cams to .5.    Bolted anchors.
content.location: Starts at the lowest point of the cliff, right of the route WMP.

content.description: Smear your way onto the slab and up to the first set of small cracks and pockets that offer some decent protection.  Follow horizontal crack right, then move up the middle of the wall (clean) to fixed anchors.
content.location: Route starts about mid-slab 60+ feet left of where the climber's trail from the road meets the access trail along the cliff.  Right of dark, unclean streaks on wall.

content.description: Shares the same start as WMP but keeps going straight up to a double bolt anchor. Run-out but easy at the top. The crux is mid-way up, but well protected.
content.protection: A few draws (7 or 8) is all you'll need. Double bolt anchors at the top. A 70m rope got us down just fine. (I can't vouch for a 60m, but I have a strong feeling that it would be fine as well)
content.location: On the main face of Sunshine City, the last route on the right before going around the corner. Shares the same start as WMP.

content.description:
Strenuous, undercling, slab climbing. This is a unique route that looks easier than it is.  

  Start on good holds next to a dead tree. Pull over the starting bulge and scramble up low angle slab to the first bolt. Follow the maze of downward facing holds up the slightly off-vertical slab. 

  Well bolted and good fun although it looks like a hold or two has broken off and a few more could be poised to pop. Belayer be warned.

One move wonder.  Scramble up a clean 5.3(X) slab to the overhang.  There is a 45 degree left leaning crack splitting the formation above.  Use this to pull the "roof" (crux) and gain the black fins above.  Exit the crack to some moderate face climbing above.  Shares the bolted anchor with Contos.
content.protection: Standard rack, crux protects with a blue C4 (.3)
content.location: About 60' right from the intersection towards the main Sunshine City face.  You will see the overhang split by the crack above.

content.description: Up flake, through shrubs for 5 feet on ledge, then up the obvious crack(s) left of the small right facing corner/crack system.  Anchors on wall above.  Great climbing for the grade.
content.protection:
Good pro for first 3/4 of the route, then nothing near the top.  By then it's barely 5.0 

  Smaller cams and nuts.  Bolted anchor.
content.location: A few feet left of Diamonds Are Forever at a flake, above a birch tree stump.

content.description:
Climb up past 2 bolts in a black, sometimes wet, right facing corner to a ledge. Follow the line of bolts, trending left up the face.  

  A great route with fun movement throughout. The bolt spacing keeps the ledge in play for several clips afterwards. An exciting lead if 5.8 is your level.
content.protection: Sport. Fixed anchors at the top.
content.location: Start 20 feet left of the toe of the cliff below a small right facing corner.

content.description: A handful of quality bolted routes line the right end of this crag. As the name implies, this crag gets lots of sun making it a fine stop for early or late season bolt clippin.
